channel.title: How To Port Forward (Microsoft Windows XP)
channel.description:
[size=14pt]Step One:[/size] Register or sign-up on: http://www.no-ip.com/ [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/21ajya8.jpg[/img]
[size=12pt]Step Two:[/size] After you have registered/signed in. Click "Hosts/Redirects" [IMG]http://i56.tinypic.com/31773ol.jpg[/img]
[size=14pt]Step Three:[/size] After you are on the host screen click "create a host" Type your server ip: "ExamplePk" (you can pick other end domains at the scroll bar) [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/4qs7wk.jpg[/img]
[size=12pt]Step Four:[/size] Go to "start" Then "All Programs" Look for "accessories" Then click command prompt [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/fk2zra.jpg[/img]
[size=14pt]Step Five:[/size] On CMD Type in "ipconfig" After you get your default ip type it in on your address bar on your internet browser [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/k9e713.jpg[/img]
[size=12pt]Step Six:[/size] After your on your default page Go to "virtual servers" [IMG]http://i51.tinypic.com/29v3ie.jpg[/img] To the same thing in "Client IP Filters"
[size=14pt]Step Seven:[/size] Go to "start" "control panel" "network and internet options" "windows firewall" [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/14x0yki.jpg[/img]
[size=12pt]Step Eight:[/size] Download no-ip here: http://www.no-ip.com/downloads.php?page=win Then open "no-ip duc" Click "select a host" Then select your no-ip name. [IMG]http://i55.tinypic.com/5afb47.jpg[/img]
[size=18pt]Then it should work ;) P.S: i can't connect to my no-ip address So please connect to: 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1 You might be able to but i can't so.
Hope this helped. Please comment (Leave dirty comments out please)[/size]

item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

All of this has been posted before, thanks but we don’t need it again.

item.title: How To Port Forward (Microsoft Windows XP)
item.dc:creator: @why_so_serious why so serious
item.description:
@why_so_serious wrote:

[size=14pt]Step One:[/size]
Register or sign-up on: http://www.no-ip.com/

[size=12pt]Step Two:[/size]
After you have registered/signed in.
Click “Hosts/Redirects”

[size=14pt]Step Three:[/size]
After you are on the host screen click “create a host”
Type your server ip: “ExamplePk” (you can pick other end domains at the scroll bar)

[size=12pt]Step Four:[/size]
Go to “start”
Then “All Programs”
Look for “accessories”
Then click command prompt

fk2zra.jpg586×757

[size=14pt]Step Five:[/size]
On CMD Type in “ipconfig”
After you get your default ip type it in on your address bar on your internet browser

[size=12pt]Step Six:[/size]
After your on your default page
Go to “virtual servers”

To the same thing in “Client IP Filters”

[size=14pt]Step Seven:[/size]
Go to “start”
“control panel”
“network and internet options”
“windows firewall”

14x0yki.jpg428×517

[size=12pt]Step Eight:[/size]
Download no-ip here: http://www.no-ip.com/downloads.php?page=win
Then open “no-ip duc”
Click “select a host”
Then select your no-ip name.

[size=18pt]Then it should work
P.S: i can’t connect to my no-ip address
So please connect to: 0.0.0.0 or 127.0.0.1
You might be able to but i can’t so.

Hope this helped.
Please comment
(Leave dirty comments out please)[/size]

Read full topic
item.source: How To Port Forward (Microsoft Windows XP)
